claim_data.description:
Hi,

I'm reaching out early to cancel our upcoming flight for August 15. My partner, Jorge Velosa Ruiz, has been hospitalized since the night of July 22 after we rushed to the ER at Clínica Reina Sofía. He was moved to a hospital room the next morning and is still admitted.

We were supposed to fly to Miami together on the 15th, but there's no way he'll be discharged or fit to travel by then. I’ve attached the certificate from the clinic that confirms everything.

I wanted to let you know ahead of time since we already know we won’t be able to make the trip. Hoping this qualifies under the medical emergency policy for cancellation.

Thanks for understanding,  
Marta Rojas Valbuena

llm_decision.explanation: The claim is approved because the provided medical certificate is an image file and confirms that Jorge Luis Velosa Ruiz was admitted to Clínica Reina Sofía on July 22, 2017, and is currently hospitalized. The certificate is dated July 27, 2017, and has a signature and official stamp. The claimant, Marta Isabel Rojas Valbuena, is Jorge's partner, and the flight is scheduled for August 15, 2017. Given that Jorge is currently hospitalized, it is reasonable to assume he will not be fit to travel by the flight date. The names match across all documents. The medical certificate is an official document and supports the claim for trip cancellation due to a medical emergency.
